results.creator_credit: Roslyn Evans, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Going, going, still here!
results.creator_credit: Garry Hammer, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description:
Garry Hammer and his family battle the Gippsland bushfires to save their home.
Garry’s story is a personal account of the fire front that swept through his property, creating its own weather, a life-threatening yet positive force that ultimately gave him a new perspective on his life and his relationship with his son.
This Digital Storytelling project was created in partnership with Arts Victoria and Latrobe City.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Garry Hammer, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Floods through fire
results.creator_credit: Lynda Code, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Lynda Code recalls the hardships of living through the Gippsland bushfires then having to cope with devastating floods. Her story of resiliance is a tribute to her family, who have battled along with her. This Digital Storytelling project was created in partnership with Arts Victoria and Latrobe City.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Lynda Code, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: Lynda Code recalls the hardships of living through the Gippsland bushfires then having to cope with devastating floods. results.title: D-Day
results.creator_credit: Darryl Jordan, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Darryl Jordan and his partner prepare their home for the encroaching bushfires. The wait for D-day is all-consuming for this family. This Digital Storytelling project was created in partnership with Latrobe City and Arts Victoria.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Darryl Jordan, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Community under siege
results.creator_credit: Suzanne Davies, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: In her role as a co-ordinator of the community centre, Suzanne Davies recounts the devastation that the Gippsland bushfires caused her community. This Digital Storytelling project was created in partnership with Latrobe City and Arts Victoria.

results.title: The Burning question
results.creator_credit: David Guy, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description:
When David moved from the city, he fulfilled a lifetime dream to live in a place he had always visited and dreamed of owning. Losing almost all of his property, he is faced with a burning question in this first-hand account of the devastating Gippsland bushfires.
This Digital Storytelling project was created in partnership with Arts Victoria and Latrobe City.

results.title: The Birchip Cropping Group
results.creator_credit: Astrid Scott, David Meagher, Dean Lawry, Jason White and ACMI Content Development
results.brief_description: A background history of the Birchip Cropping Group, an agricultural research and extension organisation covering the Wimmera Mallee region set up to assist farmers in crop production. Its philosophy is to produce food that is clean, safe and green. Presented by Alexandra, Fiona, James, Simon and the BCG.

results.title: 3 things
results.brief_description: This humourous very short experimental film has a twist to it - it has three everyday things that will make you take a second look. Fun, quirky, different.

results.title: L'Orange
results.brief_description: Filmed on location at Fitzroy High School by Year 9 students this short film parodies French arthouse cinema through its photography, movement and sound. Whimsical and somewhat amusing. Voiceover in French - no subtitles. Original soundtrack by Tom Noonan.
